comments.body: More like muffins to me! And chocolate muffins too, of course
I really like the idea of making your own emotes, so that you can sit, read, and even smell a flower. You wouldn't have to get through achievements to earn an emote.
I would make kamehamehaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
I would make kamehamehaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
Maybe it could be a rare enchantment that can only be found in loot chests, so it's not too OP

I think this should be added only to crossbows since bows have a lot of OP enchants already and tridents can get pretty powerfull. Plus crossbows take time to reload so you have to make that shot count
This is a good enchantment, so good idea
I believe a new item, maybe a staff or scepter, that shoots homing projectiles could be added instead
THAT IS AN EPIC IDEA
I am currently working on a mod that needs more enchantments and this one sounds perfect.

Maybe instead it would aim towards your crosshair rather than the closest mob, kind of like Half-Life's RPG. This way the enchantment is still helpful, but it requires more skill to take advantage of it.

i like the idea where the arrow tracks either the crosshair/ where the entity is pointing or the mob closest to that point, just so its easier to use on modded mobs. also homing could be leveled so that arrows track slowly at lower levels and are easier to evade, but at higher levels it tracks aggressively and can even be "fire and forget".

and yes, i think mobs should rarely use some weapon or attack with a similar ability, including on the player
yes, this is a great trade off, better enchanting but it has curses on it, we need more trade offs like this.

I think this needs more details but I get the concept:

Example: sharpness 5 is max on non-cursed swords, but if it had curse of vanishing on it sharpness 5 is no longer the max and there’s a higher enchantment cap
So in exchange for having your item permanently dissapear when you die (curse of vanishing) it becomes twice as powerful? Thats a really cool risk/reward idea.
three in-game days is relatively easy, would need to be longer like 100 in-game days or even longer than that, but three is relatively easy to complete

I think surviving continuously until you beat the Enderdragon and win the game (without using Totems of Undying or any other items, like potions, that would heal you) would be a better way for this achievement to work. Your invincible so you don’t need anything to heal you, except for food, or revive you.

I feel this would either be too easy, too farmable, or too controversial depending on how it is implemented.

An achievement requiring you simply survive for any given amount of time can easily be 'earned' by afking.

While yes, an achievement requiring you stay alive for an extraordinary amount of time might seem alright, afking makes it too simple and otherwise it would be off-puttingly difficult for newcomers.

An achievement requiring you survive until you have accomplished something, such as killing the ender dragon, would be impossible to add because it would mean that if a player dies once they could never get the achievement, which isn't in the nature of Minecraft's achievements.

My only idea is that perhaps one must reach 1/2 heart x amount of times in a row without dying, which (while still farmable) prevents the issue of it being exceptionally difficult for newcomers, while still being a challenge for pros or those in the end-game stage.
To easy and pointless, Philza suvived 5 real years

It's a good concept but I think maybe have it be 100 or more days or after you beat the ender dragon (from when you enter and leave the end) without any healing besides food. My final suggestion I haven't seen yet is drinking/using all strength potions with enchanted netherite or wearing enchanted netherite on general as all three of these will be end game achievements.
Advancements are never "Get X quantity of Y". This is an important detail made clear by Mojang and a view I fully agree with.

Maybe it should be more like 100 real world hours with no death (at all. like hardcore mode) and make it only achievable after you complete other achievements like kill the end dragon and wither and all the other combat related achievements. It would be hard even for long time players this way because after even one death in the world this achievement is gone or instead of having this an achievement you get once it’s an ongoing thing after you die you loose it and have to get it again.

Not dying in-game for 3 days is way too easy, as it can easily be earned by AFKing. I say to achieve this achievement, you must kill the wither boss without dying and without using any healing items except for food and golden apples.
Was this achievement removed? I recently started playing Minecraft.
Hoes could have an enchantment which either has a chance to make golden carrots grow or has a chance to make carrot crops drop golden carrots

Gamer Freddy
I agree but it HAS TO BE  in bedrock Edition too.
I would like to make a Minecraft server for my brother and me
Today's date is August 3rd, 2025.  It's been so long
Finally someone said it!

Do blast furnaces not already smelt cobblestone and stone?

 

(And yes I think this is a great idea.)
UnhandyBonsai70

Thanks for commenting/upvoting :D You say short simple and static. How short? As long as it's reasonable enough to react to in my opinion. Strafing will make the blocker's life harder so the telegraph should still be fast but reasonable. Simple I agree on, but what do you mean by static? The animation?
Tbh i think NOT having rockpaperscissors combat is one of the best parts of minecraft pvp

i think that wouldnt feel much like mc, i personally believe there are simple fixes that could make the combat way better. for example, putting part of or all of the cooldown before the attack so players are incentivized to block with reaction time rather than hiding behind it. frame one attacks just dont make sense
1.9 severely nerfed autoclickers
I disagree with cooldowns. I would, however agree with energy. If you attack in real life, over time you get tired and attacks aren't as effective. I would say have an energy level for fatigue.

Yeah but thats good. Autoclickers are cheating.

pre1.9 you only spam clicked your mouse and starifed. Not fun. Besids if you dont like the new combat just remove it with command blocks, mods, of even plugins. Its an extreamly easy thing to remove
They should add it as a gamerule so it can more easily be turned off

"1.9 severely nerfed autoclickers."

Ah yes, let's completely ruin PvP for everyone else because of a few autoclickers. As someone who plays bedrock edition (primarily for better PvP mechanics), I deal with my fair share of autoclickers, there have even been instances of what I like to call autoclicker festivals, where a bunch of autoclickers will create a faction and take over a server for a little bit. Here's the thing though, they get banned. I'd rather occasionally have to fight someone who has an advantage over me than to not be able to play at all. If anything, people who autoclick on Kit PvP servers are inadvertently helping me improve at PvP, whereas their skill set stays the same.

I'd say that they should keep it the way it is, spam clicking is simply too easy with an autoclicker or something of that sort, but i love the idea that you can spam 7 times then your arm "get tired" so you'll need a overall longer cooldown.
They need to add a weapon cooldown in bedrock
No, I like it, but I think it should be for if you block it, and it hits another player.
I do like this idea, but it is very uncommon for two ghasts to spawn near each other. It could be the second hidden advancement, the first being if you have EVERY effect on at once.
It would be even easier than it is and everyone would kill him with a shield. And so it’s like a mini-game where you need to “click” on time.
That advancement is called “Return To Sender”
This would make pvp a lot easier and there is a decent chance that we ( as mobile players) will be able to win or at least to be in the same level of fighting
yes please
been waiting for this feature for years, hope they add em soon
I am still having this problem. I cannot figure out how to adjust just the agro mob spawn rate. It is making the game unplayable and not enjoyable.

You can increase your world's simulation distance higher in advanced settings, which will expand the spawning sphere and will allow mobs to spawn further away from you. I use 8 chucks which seems to give the best results.
Why do so many mobs spawn now in bedrock? It was not this bad before, now just 30 mobs at a time spawn? Will this be fixed it makes bedrock no fun.

I strongly agree. I play more casually and mostly like making nicer builds, but I feel like there are constantly creepers spawning directly outside my house (yes, I have torches out) it makes it tedious to do anything without risking them blowing up in my face. Obviously mob loot is needed for certain items so I don’t just want to swap to peaceful or creative but it’s getting old having three to four creepers pop up consecutively on easy mode when I am just trying to garden during daylight hours.

Im do not know much about the mechanic. However I think the mob spawn rate is not too aggressive. I believe it would be better if the mob spawning was like Java's as the rates mob farms generate between version is a massive difference.

I agree. The healing takes so painstakingly long to the point where its ridiculous. This is even worse because not only is the risk of death more prominent in bedrock than Java, but there is hardcore mode now. I would like to enjoy this mode the same way the people in Java edition do, which involves fast healing.

I 100% agree. I am admittedly a very bad minecraft player, hence I like playing on easy difficulty. While that works out on java, on bedrock I literally struggle to even stay alive fighting a single zombie or skeleton due to the slow regen rate :'D... Genuinely wish they would make healing on bedrock as fast as it is on Java, or at least a bit faster on easier difficulties.

Same Here, I start a new survival world every time a major update comes out. I like to keep my old worlds around but when I explore more of my current world, the game will tell me out of space. I have a 400GB micro SD card, and only two gigabytes is ridiculous.

The 1.18 update has now made this a big problem on Switch. I can't upgrade my world because of this limit so now my world is bricked and there's no rolling the update back... I only have the ONE world on bedrock, it's ridiculous and I'm flaming mad
Same here. The 2GB limit is ABSURD.

My kid found a world they wanted on marketplace. That world is like 800mb and we can't download it because of this incredibly stupid 2gb limit. I have a 512gb micro sd card. It should be up to me how much space of that card I want to use. Most switch games take up more than 2gb, Minecraft please get with Nintendo and fix this.

I find it annoying that Fortnite can hold 21.3 GB upon downloading but Minecraft is only allowed 2 GB on a Nintendo Switch. Please fix this issue!!! My son LOVES Minecraft more than any other game and he is starting to dislike playing because of the limitations on storage. He gets extremely excited when he purchases mods on the marketplace just to be let down when he can't download them. He will soon be obligated to choose to find a new game that he can play without limitations.

Pretty ridiculous when some of the texture packs are 500mb…
I purchased Kingdoms and to be able to use it, so I didn’t just throw away $10, I had to remove a handful of old worlds and a bunch of addons…

I downloded a mod resource pack that my sons were super excited about only for my switch not to let me downlode it because of this stupid 2gb limit for Minecraft... So there is 20 dollars down the drain
This is a duplicate of this one made in 2019, but I wholeheartedly agree!
same i have 3 users for all my worlds and they are still filling up on storage
Please do something, this can not be so hard ?
Hi
Not join friend why
This reminds me that I can’t join my friend of this device only! Someone please help.

This would be nice, because sometimes, when I find a nice color and be like: "Oh, I want to put this on my leather tunic!" but I don't have 10 000 cauldrons to store all nice colors I found, so this would be neat to store nice colors to dye leather armor.
This would be cool for custom rivers and lakes and pools
What if we could also use it to dye pools of water? Adding onto another comment, it could be used to create custom rivers and lakes as well

Adding a crafting recipe: bucket of water + dye : to color source water block. Can create colorful fountains and..like was mentioned custom rivers. It would save on a lot of dyed glass. 🙂 Perhaps colorful water walls.
Why can’t we do it in bedrock??
Just allow us to customise em like we could on console edition!

pedroKlein3352

Before I went to Xbox One, my old Xbox 360 had fully customizable super flats, one world had a big chunk of air at like Y 15, and it made it super fun to explore a whole area that was empty and pitch black
Great idea! For example you want do build a Secret Base on Y 12.
I’d like the other metals to be considered, as well. All metal types being available would allow greater aesthetic flexibility.
At once or separately?

i was going to try to do a superflat in survival hoping for villages to spawn and i found none so i looked on the internet and surprise, no. so i (and alot of other bedrock players) would want customization for bedrock

Yeah, the old Superflat worlds were amazing. If you wanted to build a specific biome related minigame or structure you could use a custom Superflat to get a world with the one biome. And it made it easier because no hills.
